Indian Economy.title: NITI calls for developing Corporate Bond Market to reduce dependency on bank led debt
Indian Economy.summary: India’s corporate bond market stands at roughly $650 billion, whereas the United Kingdom—an economy smaller than India in GDP ranking—has a corporate bond market exceeding $4 trillion, nearly six times larger.

Banking & Finance.title: RBI eases transaction account norms for banks
Banking & Finance.summary: Banks can now offer cash credit account to customers basis their needs without any restrictions. Further, a bank may maintain current account or OD account without any restriction in case of customers with less than ₹10 crore exposure to banks.

Banking & Finance.title: OMO auction for G-Secs purchase fully subscribed; banks get ₹50k liquidity
Banking & Finance.summary: The aforementioned OMO purchase auction is part of the liquidity injection measures announced by the RBI in its bi-monthly monetary policy review.

Banking & Finance.title: RBI scraps plan to limit corporate current accounts to two big lenders
Banking & Finance.summary: The RBI has withdrawn its restrictive proposal on current accounts for corporate borrowers after a pushback from private banks. The revised guidelines permit banks to offer accounts based on customer requirements, aiming to balance competition and improve mon…

Banking & Finance.title: Digital lending startup Stasfin eyes IPO in 12-18 months, co-founder says
Banking & Finance.summary: Digital lending startup Stasfin plans to launch an IPO in 12-18 months, targeting Rs 2,800-2,900 crore AUM by FY26.

Banking & Finance.title: Fed rate cut boosts sentiment, yet India’s policy and rupee to stay domestically driven
Banking & Finance.summary: While Fed rate cuts ease global liquidity and market pressures, India’s policy decisions and rupee stability continue to be driven by domestic economic conditions.
